other_tests.findings: HbA1c was 6.7%, increased from 6.4% at the last office visit with his pediatric endocrinologist 3 months prior.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The HbA1c rose from 6.4% to 6.7% over three months.

other_tests.findings: The C-peptide was 1.2 ng/mL (reference 0.8 - 3.2 ng/mL), indicating evidence of residual β-cell function.
2-hour post-prandial UCPCR of > 0.2 nmol/mmol was reported.
Revealed a pathogenic mutation in HNF4A (c.790: del ‘G’ resulting in p.Val264Cys frameshift mutation).

Lipid panel demonstrated total cholesterol of 137 mg/dL, HDL of 25 mg/dL, LDL of 76 mg/dL, and triglyceride level of 182 mg/dL. His dilated retinal examination did not demonstrate retinopathy, and the urine albumin to creatinine ratio was 17 mg/g.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The patient has remained on monotherapy with once weekly semaglutide treatment for more than one year with HbA1c < 6.5% and without notable side effects or complications.
